moves.1. e4 c5 2. d4: Starts out as the Scisillian.. Lets see what happens
moves.2... cxd4 3. Nf3 d6 4. Nxd4 Nf6 5. Nc3 B: Bd7? I am beginning to like my position
moves.6. Bc4 g6 7. Bg5: Lets put some pressure on that king side.
moves.7... Bg7: Black opts for the sniper game, but lacks any coordinated attack. I feel no threat at this point in the game, and opt to castle while considering my plan of attack
moves.8. O-O O-O 9. a4: I was a little out of good moves here. Maybe start an attack on the queen side can open things up?
moves.9... Nc6 10. Nxc6: Black tries to reconquer the middle, i won't allow it, and removes his Knight that could support his bishop at g7.
moves.10... Bxc6 11. f3 a6 12. b4: As soon as I made this move, i thought that Black might go for the Rook at a1. Looking at how my pieces all where lined up for the king side assault, i thought this is the time to strike, let this be a trap. With the queen at a1 and a bishop at h6 it would be a short game.
moves.13. Nxe4 Bxa1: From this point on, it is a loosing battle for black..
moves.14. Qxa1: Notice how the queen has access to the king, just need the bishop on h6
moves.14... Bxe4: Great move (for me). Now the pressure can be increased by moving the f-pawn out of the way
moves.15. fxe4: Notice all the attack lines toward the king side, just need to move that bishop to h6
moves.15... Qb6+: That was the only move left for black
moves.16. Kh1 e5: Without this move, he would have been mate really fast. Block the queens path to the king.
moves.17. Bh6: Now the focus of the attack is moved to the black f-pawn
moves.17... Rfe8 18. Rxf7: From here it is a mate by moving Rf8
moves.18... d5 19. Bxd5: Keep the pressure from the bishop
moves.19... Re6 20. Qf1: This move brings the queen back in play with an additional mate opportunity
moves.20... Qd6 21. Bxe6: Black resigns. The next moves would be 21: .. Qxe6 22: Rh8+ Rxh8 23: Qxh8++
